00017 /**
00018  * test grid::pconnect()/pdisconnect()
00019  *
00020  * Grid::connect() opens a connection to a Grid UI server (a server that
00021  * allows one to submit and monitor jobs in the grid). It is much like
00022  * 'rsh' allowing one to send commands to the UI node.
00023  *
00024  + This routine tests Grid::connect() by opening a connection to a user
00025  * interface node, executing a simple command (ls -l) on it (on the
00026  * UI node itself) and disconnecting.
00027  *
00028  */
00029 function test_grid_pconnect()
00030 {
00031     global $user, $host, $passwd, $passphrase;
00032     
00033     $eg = new Grid;
00034     $eg->set_user($user);       // does nothing
00035     $eg->set_host($host);       // does nothing
00036     $eg->set_password($passwd);
00037     $eg->set_passphrase($passphrase);
00038     $eg->set_work_dir("/tmp/grid/test");
00039     $eg->set_error_log("/tmp/grid/test/connection.err");
00040     $eg->pconnect();
00041     fwrite($eg->std_in, "ls -l\nlogout\n");
00042     fflush($eg->std_in);
00043     while (!feof($eg->std_out)) {
00044         $line = fgets($eg->std_out, 1024);
00045         if (strlen($line) == 0) break;
00046         echo $line."<br />\n";
00047     }
00048     $ret = $eg->pdisconnect();
00049     print_r($ret);
00050     echo "\n<br />\n<hr><br />\n";
00051 }
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * test Grid::pinitialize()
00055  *
00056  * Grid::pinitialize() allows us to identify ourselves to the Grid.
00057  * Identification must be made from a UI node, hence we need to connect
00058  * first to a UI node.
00059  *
00060  * In later versions, initialize() detects if we are already connected
00061  * and if not, opens the connection implicitly for us. Both scenarios
00062  * should be checked.
00063  */
00064 function test_grid_pinit()
00065 {
00066     global $user, $host, $passwd, $passphrase;
00067 
00068     $eg = new Grid;
00069     $eg->set_user($user);
00070     $eg->set_host($host);
00071     $eg->set_password($passwd);
00072     $eg->set_passphrase($passphrase);
00073     $eg->set_work_dir("/tmp/grid/test");
00074     $eg->set_error_log("/tmp/grid/test/connection.err");
00075 // try both, with an existing connection and without
00076 //      $eg->pconnect();
00077 //      if not connected, initialize() will open an implicit connection
00078     $eg->pinitialize();
00079     $eg->pdestroy();
00080     $eg->pdisconnect();
00081 }
00082 
00083 function test_grid_init()
00084 {
00085     global $user, $host, $passwd, $passphrase;
00086 
00087     $eg = new Grid;
00088     $eg->set_user($user);
00089     $eg->set_host($host);
00090     $eg->set_password($passwd);
00091     $eg->set_passphrase($passphrase);
00092     $eg->set_work_dir("/tmp/grid/test/cless");
00093     $eg->set_error_log("/tmp/grid/test/cless/connection.err");
00094     if (!$eg->initialize())
00095         echo "error: couldn't init the grid\n";
00096     else
00097         echo "OK";
00098     $eg->destroy();
00099 }

00247     sleep(5);   // give time to run

00269     if (! $eg->job_submit("tst-job", $out))
00270        echo "error: coudn't start the job\n";

00280         echo "error: couldn't get job output\n";

00282         echo "OK\n";
